headline: Tech rally, US-Taiwan chip deal, power grid auction: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are perked up in Friday's premarket as the tech sector and bank stocks are looking to rally. Chip stocks are roaring to life this morning after the US struck a trade deal with Taiwan, which includes Taiwanese tech companies investing a total of $250 billion into US semiconductor manufacturing. Lastly, the Trump administration is teaming up with governors to hold an emergency power auction to resolve the surging power costs expected from Big Tech's AI data centers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Tech rally, US-Taiwan chip deal, power grid auction: 3 Things
content.description:
US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are perked up in Friday's premarket as the tech sector and bank stocks are looking to rally.

Chip stocks are roaring to life this morning after the US struck a trade deal with Taiwan, which includes Taiwanese tech companies investing a total of $250 billion into US semiconductor manufacturing.

Lastly, the Trump administration is teaming up with governors to hold an emergency power auction to resolve the surging power costs expected from Big Tech's AI data centers.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Stocks waver on Wall Street and remain near records
summary: Stocks wavered in morning trading on Wall Street Friday as the first week of corporate earnings season closes out with markets trading near record levels. The S&P 500 rose 0.1%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 83 points, or 0.2%, as of 10:07 a.m.

content.title: Stocks waver on Wall Street and remain near records
content.summary: Stocks wavered in morning trading on Wall Street Friday as the first week of corporate earnings season closes out with markets trading near record levels. The S&P 500 rose 0.1%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 83 points, or 0.2%, as of 10:07 a.m.

headline: 3 Chip Stocks to Buy for 2026, According to an Analyst
summary: On Friday, analyst Blayne Curtis said  Broadcom Nvidia  and  Marvell Technology  are among his favorite chip stock ideas for 2026.  “AVGO [Broadcom] remains our Top Pick but NVDA [Nvidia] looks cheap,” he wrote.  The analyst has price targets for Broadcom and Marvell of $500 and $120, respectively.
